item.title: Allbirds is closing its last brick-and-mortar store in San Francisco
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Once symbolic of a mid-2010s San Francisco tech bro, Allbirds is cutting costs to "support the long-term health of the business."

item.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026: Plus-one passes are almost gone and only 3 days remain
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: The TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 plus-one passes at 50% off are almost sold out, and this deal ends in 3 days. Register here before this deal ends on Friday, January 30 at 11:59 p.m. PT.

item.title: Trump’s acting cybersecurity chief uploaded sensitive government docs to ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: A report cited officials as saying that Homeland Security sought to determine if there was any harm to government security as a result of the lapse.

item.title: The AI infrastructure boom shows no sign of slowing down
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: ASML’s record orders show chipmakers are still betting big on AI data centers.

item.title: Standard Nuclear raises $140M as nuclear power enters its gold rush era
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Investors including a16z are betting that nuclear industry suppliers will be the big winners of the AI demand-driven nuclear renaissance.

item.title: LinkedIn will let you show off your vibe-coding chops with a certificate
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: LinkedIn is partnering with Descript, Lovable, Replit, and Relay.app at launch.

item.title: The conference where founders scale: TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026 tickets are now live at the lowest prices
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Founder Summit 2026 unites 1,100 founders and investors in Boston on June 23 for a day focused on real-world scaling insights and networking that pushes the needle. Save up to $300 on your ticket.

item.title: Samsung teases new privacy feature to hide your Galaxy phone screen from onlookers
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Samsung said that the upcoming feature will let you protect selected parts of the screen like notification popup area.

item.title: Anthropic, Apple, OpenAI CEOs condemn ICE violence, praise Trump
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Anthropic's Dario Amodei and OpenAI's Sam Altman spoke out against ICE enforcement tactics following Minneapolis violence, with one addressing concerns publicly and the other in an internal message.

item.title: Amazon says it is laying off 16,000 employees
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: This is Amazon's second layoff after the company cut 14,000 corporate jobs in October.

item.title: Snap gets serious about Specs, spins AR glasses into standalone company
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The social media company's smartglasses are set to be released to the public later this year.

item.title: Redwood attracts Google for its $425M Series E as AI power needs rise
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Google is the latest investor to back Redwood Materials as the battery recycling startup scales a new energy storage venture to power AI data centers and other industrial sites.

item.title: Waabi raises $1B and expands into robotaxis with Uber
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Waabi has secured a $750 million Series C round to accelerate autonomous trucking, and another roughly $250 million commitment from Uber to deploy 25,000 robotaxis exclusively on its platform.

item.title: Google pitches Gemini to students studying for India’s most competitive college entrance exam
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Google's launch of practice tests for JEE follows its recent move to offer full-length SAT practice tests in Gemini.

item.title: Google Photos brings its prompt-based editing feature to India, Australia and Japan
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Users can describe their edits in natural language to modify an image.

item.title: India’s Shadowfax slips on listing, as client concentration spooks investors
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Shadowfax shares fell about 9% on theirdebut, valuing the logistics firm near its last private valuation.

item.title: What you should know about the owners of US TikTok
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: ​ByteDance, TikTok’s Chinese parent company, recently established a separate American entity to run the app’s U.S. operations. This restructuring aims to separate U.S. TikTok from its Chinese parent, addressing concerns about data privacy and foreign control. The move came after years of pressure from lawmakers, who feared the Chinese government’s potential access to Americans’ data. […]

item.title: Everything you need to know about viral personal AI assistant Clawdbot (now Moltbot)
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Personal AI assistant Moltbot —formerly Clawdbot — has gone viral in a matter of weeks. But there’s more you should know before jumping on the bandwagon.

item.title: Fashion rental app By Rotation and Uber partner to help deliver ski clothing
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: By Rotation, one of the U.K.’s most popular peer-to-peer fashion rental platforms, is partnering with Uber to deliver ski clothes.

item.title: Anduril has invented a wild new drone-flying contest where jobs are the prize
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: This is a race series for software programmers and the brainchild of founder Palmer Luckey, he tells TechCrunch.
